tokenMeta.data: Bedford Elementary School
Replacement
PSCP #XX.XXX.XX XX
Base-mounted end suction pumps.
Motor:  Section 23 05 13.
Vibration-control supports:  Section 23 05 48.
Variable frequency drives:  Section 26 29 23.
Product data:  For each type of pump, indicate certified performance curves and rated
capacities, operating characteristics, furnished specialties, final impeller dimensions,
performance curve at rimmed impeller diameter and scheduled performance point, and
accessories for each type of product indicate. Indicate pump’s operating point on curves.
Include data verifying compliance with ASHRAE 90.1, or provide certified performance ratings
by a qualified independent testing agency.
Unit shown on drawings is based on the dimensions of the design basis unit specified in Part 2
below.  If another acceptable manufacturer’s unit should be proposed, ascertain that it will fit in
the available space.  Include, with shop drawings of the unit, scale drawings similar to the
contract drawings, including plans, and sections, showing any changes in the wiring,
arrangement, or access necessary to accommodate the unit furnished.
Shop drawings shall show complete dimensions of complete assembled unit with accessories.
Include wiring diagram showing factory and field wiring.
UL label and local testing (if required):  As specified in Section 23 05 00, Common Work Results
for HVAC.
HVAC equipment shall meet the energy performance requirements of ASHRAE 90.1.
Department of Energy (DOE) compliance:  Pump manufactures shall comply with US
Department of Energy (DOE) energy conservation standard that pertains to applicable pumps
with 1 horsepower or greater.  These pumps shall be evaluated using the Pump Energy Index
(PEI) that determines the efficiency rating and DOE compliance.  The lower the number the
higher the efficiency.
Pumps shall have a PEI rating of 1 or less to comply with the standard.
The PEI compliant rating shall appear on the pumps permanent nameplate
HVAC PUMPS  23 2123-1
©2019 James Posey Associates, Inc. 6999-18
Bedford Elementary School
Replacement
PSCP #XX.XXX.XX XX
Basis-of-design product:  Subject to compliance with requirements, provide the scheduled
product, or comparable product by one of the following:
Base-mounted end-suction pumps
Armstrong Pump Co.
ITT Bell and Gossett.
Taco Inc.
Pump shall have capacities and electrical characteristics as shown on the drawings.
Pumps shall be factory-assembled and factory-tested.
Single-phase motors shall be permanent split-capacitor type with built-in thermal overload
protection.
Pumps shall comply with the DOE Energy Conservation Standard with a PEI rating of 1 or less.
Armstrong 4030, Taco FI Series, or Bell and Gossett e-1510.
General description:  Pumps shall be base-mounted, centrifugal, separately-coupled, end-
suction, single-stage, bronze-fitted, vertical (radially) split-case design with overhung impeller.
Pumps and seals shall be rated for continuous operation at a minimum working pressure of 175
psig (1200 kPa) and a minimum temperature of 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
Casing:
Cast iron.
Flanged piping connections conforming to ASME B16.1.
Casings shall allow removal and replacement of impellers without disconnecting piping.
Threaded gauge taps at inlet and outlet flange connections.
Threaded taps for seal flushing piping.
Threaded drain plug at the bottom of volute.
Impeller:  ASTM B584 cast bronze, statically and dynamically balanced, closed, single-suction,
keyed to shaft and secured by a locking cap screw. Trim impellers to exceed scheduled flow
and head by fifteen percent.
Seals:  Internally flushed (self-flushing) type mechanical seals with carbon steel rotating ring,
stainless-steel spring, ceramic seat, and flexible bellows and gasket. Provide seal flushing
piping from pump discharge to seal flushing inlet tap.
Shaft and sleeve:  Steel shaft, with bronze sleeve.
Bearings:  Grease-lubricated ball bearings in cast-iron housing with grease fittings.
HVAC PUMPS  23 2123-2
©2019 James Posey Associates, Inc. 6999-18
Bedford Elementary School
Replacement
PSCP #XX.XXX.XX XX
Couplings:  Flexible, capable of absorbing torsional vibration and shaft misalignment, complete
with metal coupling guard mounted to frame.  For pumps operating with variable-frequency
drives, provide couplings suitable for variable-speed duty.
Mounting frame:  Factory-welded frame and cross members, fabricated of steel channels and
angles conforming to ASTM B 36.  Fabricate for mounting pump casing, coupler guard, and
motor.  Grind welds smooth prior to application of factory finish.  Mounting holes for field-
installed motors shall be field-drilled.  Secure motor to mounting frame with adjustable
alignment.
Provide suction diffuser with adjustable support foot, gauge tap, inlet connection to suit pipe
size, outlet to suit pump suction size, cast-iron angle-type body with inlet vanes, and stainless
steel strainer with 3/16-inch (4.8-mm) maximum diameter openings.  The flow direction shall be
from inside to outside.  Provide disposable fine mesh strainers for system flushing and cleaning.
Pumps shall be provided with guard over belt drive or flexible couplings as required by OSHA
and MOSHA.
Provide balancing valve in discharge piping for reading flow rate. Flow rate shall be adjusted
using balancing valve for pumps that do not have variable frequency drives. Flow rate shall be
adjusted using variable speed drives where they are provided, with balancing valve fully open.
Provide center-guided, spring-loaded silent-action check valves in discharge piping.
Provide valves for pump isolation on the suction and discharge sides of each pump.
Provide gauge taps at the inlet of each pump inlet strainer
Support:
On slab on grade, anchor pump to concrete equipment foundation.
On floors above grade, mount pump on isolation base and provide vibration isolators
between the base and the floor as specified in Section 23 05 48, Vibration Control
Supports for HVAC.
Set preliminary pump alignment and grout pump base.
When grout is set and hardened, make final pump alignment.
Provide flexible connections between pump assembly and piping.
As specified in Section 23 05 00, provide operating instructions.
Provide at least one hour of additional instruction time for the equipment specified in this
section.
HVAC PUMPS  23 2123-3
©2019 James Posey Associates, Inc. 6999-18
Bedford Elementary School
Replacement
PSCP #XX.XXX.XX XX
